Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Everybody! Everybody! Listen up, I need your ideas, now! Ideas please, right now! Go! Go! Come on!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Michael we don't know what you're talking about...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Wet cement, outside. It's drying fast, come on. This is a lifelong dream. What do I write? What do I write?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Michael you could put your initials in it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: M.G.S.? No. Some idiot named Mark Greg Sputnik will claim credit for it. I don't...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah that's true.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Once in a lifetime opportunity people! Come on, here we go!

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: We- we-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Here we go!

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Well-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Let's, yes?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: When I was a little girl...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay... Okay, do it! Go on! Great! Let's hear it!

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: We-we found some wet cement in the park...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's drying, it's drying...

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: In our neighborhood...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Alright, hablbelah, come on, Phyl!

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: What did we write?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ahh come on!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Here it is, you should draw a picture...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Cause that says, that says...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: So much more than words...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No!! Come on, gimme something good!

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Ok, ok, I was watching E!, and I saw Will Smith outside the Chinese Theater, and omhmygod, he looked so good...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Pam, translate.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: She's talking about the handprints that celebrities make in the cement.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I love it!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: If you were a real star you would put your face in it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I love it more!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Michael that doesn't seem... safe.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I... love it!! Haha, come on!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Come on! [Kevin and Dwight laugh and follow Michael]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: We are here today, not to immortalize a man, but an idea... Maybe the idea of a man.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [with petroleum jelly on his face] Hurry, please.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Greatness is only skin deep, some people say...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Can you breathe?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well that's not true. Other people believe it's deeper inside...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hold your breath.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: And in this case...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ready?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That's also not true.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: And... go. [Michael sticks his face in the cement] Force it in as deep as you can.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [muffled] That's what she said.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Today is a very special day for me. And it's really not about me, it's about my grandkids, it's about my great grandkids... I can come back here when I'm 100, and I can find that piece of cement and say, "That's me. Look kids, your daddy left that face hole..." I dunno, it's a good feeling.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [playing with Madlibs] Okay, adjective...

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Um... tall. No, no, uh, nice.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Good one. Okay, you ready?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Mmhmm.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [reads] The tall man entered the nice building to visit a very nice man. "Sit down, Mr. Smith, can I interest you in any good... cat food?"

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [laughing] It's a man eating cat food.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What about a cat eating man food?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Andy and Angela seem very happy... I hope nothing horrible ever happens to them.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [wearing glasses] Um... yeah, I slept over at a, uh, friend's house and, I forgot my contact solution, so... I had to wear my backup glasses... Shut up.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right, everybody... Oh my God, Pam, those make you look so ugly. Um, Pam, in order to get hotter, you take the glasses off. You're moving in the wrong direction...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I don't have my contacts...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ub, dub dah, don't need, I can't even hear you. It's just noise coming out of an ugly scientist. Um, everybody, we're going to have a little brainstorming session in the conference room.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ener-gize...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You know what would energize me? If you, Pamela Morgan Beesly...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Don't, don't-

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Would...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: If you propose to me during a Michael meeting, I will say no.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, it's too late, because I'm proposing... that you get me a cup of coffee, which would energize me greatly, and make me the happiest man in the world.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Everybody, so how are we going to energize our office? I mean, I haven't done anything since Christmas. Pam, clearly, has just given up trying. So what we need to do is we get things going, we need to get percolating a little bit. Anybody have any ideas of what we could do. Any suggestions? Yes, Andy?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What if we changed our outgoing answering machine message, so it just had a little more... zing, and a little more pep?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Zing and pep, see that's those are the kind of words we're looking for. Yes, Jim?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What about if we did an even newer voicemail message that had even more zing and pep?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Now we're cooking. I like this. Maybe a whole theme, like a rap. A rap rhyme...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: An urban thing...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: An urban, yeah, Stanley? You wanna help us out with that?... Stanley, earth to Stanley...

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Not me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes you. Come on, Stanley, put your little game down and join the group.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Stanley, we're havin a little...

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Leave me alone, dammit.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We're havin a little brainstorm session...

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: DID I STUTTER?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: ...Good, this is good. I'm going to grab a glass of water.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Can I talk to you a second?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ugh, what?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Uh, I really think that you need to address what happened with Stanley this morning...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What are you blabbering about? Nothing happened.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Well, you know, Stanley was openly insubordinate.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That? In the conference room?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We were joshin around, the two of us, and he said "did I stutter," and I said "wha-wha-wha-wha-what, dawg?" It was joking, Toby, alright?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: He didn't seem like he was joking.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well you don't get it, because Stanley is a beautiful, sassy, powerful black man, and you're... you. If you had any friends, you would understand. Friends joke with one another:

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You meet a lot of ladies driving an Xterra, because you pull up to a stoplight, and look over and there's an Xterra next to you. They're always driven by chicks, so there's your icebreaker.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [kicks the car] Unh! Scratch.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: That's a racing stripe.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Uh, bumper's sagging.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Mmm, I doubt that very much.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: This car's crap. I will buy it for next to nothing.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: How next to?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Well, here are your options:

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: What.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I, uh, see that you... gave me that form that I asked you to give me, Stanley the manly, so thank you for that. I guess we are back to normal.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: What are you talking about?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, you know, uh, the thing that you said earlier, that you didn't mean, um, and that I forgive you for. The whole thing's silly, isn't it? Friends don't need to apologize to friends as far as I'm concerned, so we are cool.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I am not going to apologize to you.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: It's like I used to tell my wife, I do not apologize unless I think I'm wrong, and if you don't like it you can leave. And I say the same thing to my current wife, and I'll say it to my next one too.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Jim is in charge of Stanley only in sales-related matters, hence the green line-green for money-sales, get it?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Uh huh...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: There is this yellow zigzag that does give Ryan the authority to discipline Stanley...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Great

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: However, in so doing, it zigs past your name, hence zagging you and making you appear weak. Thus the yellow color. Yellow for cowardly.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What's the pink?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Menstrual cycles.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok... Is there anybody up here, anybody at all, that can deal with this?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Other than me.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Well, there is the emergency disaster mode for the org chart. This gives me full authority over every single person in the office.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I never said you could do that.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: All you have to do it say it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Just say it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, I will think about it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Say it. Just do it. Don't think, say it. Do it. Five, four, three, two... do it. Give me control. Michael... I promise to give authority back to you when this crisis is over. Do it, Michael. Do it. Hey, this office needs a strong man. Say it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: So... All right, well, you're gonna have to deal with this yourself.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Hey Pam, I really like your glasses.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: All the girlfriends that I've ever had have worn glasses.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, okay...

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yeah, it's kind of a turn-on for me actually...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I should probably get back to...

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Like librarians.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Entering the....

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Could you just say, "these are due back Thursday"?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No. [Kevin leaves; Pam takes off her glasses; phone rings] Dunder Mifflin, this is Pam. Okay, go ahead. [puts a notepad close to her face and writes message]

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: A lot of jazz cats are blind, but they can play the piano like nobody's business. I'd like to put the piano in front of Pam without her glasses and see what happens. I'd also like to see her topless.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Mike.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I'm very busy here, man.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Darryl, [clears throat] have you ever been in a gang?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Why?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's an advice question, and if you don't wanna talk about it, I completely understand. It's, um...

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: No, no, no...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I know, it's very, very personal...

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: No, um... I have.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I knew it. Okay, who we talking about here? Crips? Bloods?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Both.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: God.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Yeah them, and the Latin Kings... the Warriors...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Newsies.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, so dig this:

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: [to Toby] I think it's self-explanatory. [to Jim] Hey, Jim, come here for a second. Can you answer me something, as, as a true Eagles fan?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh boy...

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: How do you live with a franchise this bad?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: On a wing and a prayer, mostly.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Alright, whatever you say. Uh, listen, while I have you here with Toby, I need to give you a formal warning about your job performance.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: A formal warning... [chuckles]

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: It's actually not a joke. I know how you spend your time here, and I know how little you care about your job. And honestly if you spent as much time selling as you do goofing around with Dwight and hanging out at reception, we wouldn't be having this conversation.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [stammers] I'm sorry, is, is this because I talked to Wallace about your website? Because I really didn't mean to go over your head.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: This is nothing to do with that, alright? I always appreciate constructive criticism about my job performance. I thrive on it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm sorry, then do you mind explaining a little better? Cause I'm not sure what's really...

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Woah, don't get all defensive, alright? It's just a warning. If you want the details, Toby can provide them. You take it easy, alright?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I'd say all the goofing around at Pam's desk, and, and hanging out with Pam, has finally caught up to him... w-with Pam

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey, what happened? What did Ryan want?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh we were just... talking about, bureaucratic stuff...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Because you're very important?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [washing the Xterra] Rocka doopa deepa do POW! Shacka do DO! Oh! What's Dwight up to? Oh probably nothing. Racka do do dee do-do do-do! Sha-KA!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What the hell is this all about? [holds up flier] You're flipping my car for profit.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's my car now.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I gave you a deal... based on what you said to me.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah, well... seller beware. Now if you'll excuse me, I've got to monitor a three-way bidding war for my car on eBay.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I've got a Madlib for you:

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, everybody, shh! So, earlier today, Stanley sassed me, and Toby gave me some suggestions on how to discipline him. They did not work, obviously, because they were stupid, so I am now going to fake fire him.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What does that mean?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's like a mock execution.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That's not a good idea.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes it is a good idea. It's the only possible solution I have left.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Well, you can actually fire him.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, okay... I've had enough of you.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Why are you telling us this?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Because I want you to behave as if I'm actually firing him, Oscar, okay?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Michael, if you hadn't told us this, then we would've thought that you were actually firing him.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm not firing him. I'm not, I need you to act like I am firing him. Just, what I'm going to do, is I'm going to pretend that I am firing him, and I need you to act like I am firing him. Do you get that? Do you get it? I'm teaching him a lesson. He needs to learn humility, alright? That's all I'm, okay, here he comes. Let's just... play act. [Stanley enters the room] Stanley, may I talk to you for a second?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Stanley Hudson, you are fired.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Are you serious?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I am serious, we are all serious. You are fired like a heart attack.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: You're firing me over three words. Have you lost your mind? Do you think I'm gonna let you do this to me?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I've watched you screw up this office for ten years, and I'm filing a lawsuit, and I'm gonna tell them about every stupid thing you've ever done up in this office.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Alright alright, okay, you know what? Now you know how I feel. This was a fake firing. Lesson learned. Good work, everybody. Very nice.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: So I'm not fired.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's it. And uh... do you have anything to say to me?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Oh yes, I do. You are out of your damn, little pea-sized, mind. What is wrong with you? Do you have any sense? At all?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay...

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Do you have any idea how to run an office?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Every day you do something stupider than you did the day before.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's not-

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: And I think, "there's no possible way-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right, all right...

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: He can top that."

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: But what do you do?! You find a way, dammit, to top it! You are professional idiot!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, STOP IT! Okay, everybody out.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Who?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Everybody, except Stanley.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Let's go.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I can't find my glasses.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, you know what? Why don't you take my hand, and leave them, and let's get out of here.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay, okay.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [chuckling] It's Michael versus Stanley, and it is the clash of the titans. In one corner, you have Michael, and he is mad. And then, in the other corner, you have Stanley, and he's mad. So that's about it!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [starts to cry] I don't understand why you keep picking on me.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Oh, for the love of God.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You just, do, and I don't know why, so... please help me understand.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Fine. Here it is:

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I am good person, and sometimes, good people don't get no respect. Rodney Dangerfield. [as Rodney Dangerfield] Hey, I don't get no respect. No respect at all. When I was in the sandbox as a kid, I got not respect. My wife likes to talk after sex, so she called me from a hotel room, and said, "I don't respect you!" Ahh, thoughtless. Aw, you know what don't get no respect? Airplane food. Why don't they just make the plane out of the airline food? My wife don't get no respect, some-take her, please, for example. [as Jeff Foxworthy] If you don't get no respect, you might be redneck. [as Borat] Respect is niiice. Borat. [as Rodney Dangerfield] What's the deal with Grapenuts? No grapes, no nuts. I don't get no respect!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So I'm thinking, as a reward for our loyal clients, that we contact their assistants, and we find out where they live. And then, we go to their houses, in the middle of the summer, and go caroling. It is a summer Christmas sale-abration. And we call it, a summer sales-a-lot. Feedback? Anybody? Stanley?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Has potential to be your best idea yet. [Michael smiles]

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: That's the dumbest thing I ever heard. [laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Dammit, Phyllis. Alright, everybody out except Phyllis.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know, I don't care what he did to me. He's mean to other people, that's what gets me. He's just...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Who else is he mean to?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Everybody. He just, he's always, he's always talking about people behind their backs to me.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What kind of stuff does Stanley say?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Like that people are stupid, and that they're idiots, and that they're sluts.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Why would he say that?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Because he's mean. He's, he's like a really mean-spirited guy. He talks about how gay Oscar is...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Mm-hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And that Angela's a midget, and that [indicates Jim] your chin is too big.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I know, I know. I think it's tiny. I think it's too small if anything. And that your glasses make you look ugly.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: She's never worn these glasses before.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, he's just mean.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Michael, I think that what Stanley did to you was rude. Maybe you should just get him aside and tell him that he was behaving badly.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's complicated, Pam. I mean, the world looks a lot easier from behind your reception desk.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, I actually agree with her, I think you should talk to him. And you also might want to explain to Andy that no one wants to help him decide whether or not he has a rash.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Oh, yeah, and then, yell at Creed, because you know what? Looking can be as bad as touching.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I put Stanley on a pedestal, for a long time. But sometimes he can just be a big, fat jerk. I... jerks don't deserve to be on pedestals. Jerks should be placed up somewhere where everybody can see how jerky they are. Big marble... jerk stand.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Pam, stand up.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hi everyone. My name is Pam, and I wear glasses.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Hi, Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Pretty disgusting.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I like your frames.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Thanks, Phyllis. Yours, too.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Oh, well, I'm already married. Boys don't make passes at girls who wear glasses.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Ignore her, those glasses are so cool.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Yeah, you look like Lisa Loeb or Tina Fey or someone. You should definitely wear them all the time.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Huh. Maybe I will.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Guess who just became the cutest girl in the office.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What's it like without my glasses? Um, well, here, I'll show you. Unfocus your lens. A lot. I'm 20/400. You got it? Okay, I'm gonna spend the rest of the day like this. I can't see any of the things that would bother me on a normal day. I can't see anything disgusting, or ugly, or Michael... it's great.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yo!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hi, can I help you?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Haha, nice! I guess I have been a stranger lately.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [pointing] Ryan!

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Hey, Pam, do you want a bagel? [throws it]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Think fast. [it hits her in the face] Honestly, Pam, the bagels in New York are the only good bagels in the world, I swear to God.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: The only good bagels anywhere.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I've heard that. [reaches down to pick up bagel from the floor]

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Same with coffee, and women.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I'm gonna go find Toby. Oh, here's what you do. [takes her bagel] You scoop out the middle, like that, and then you just eat the shell. You know? [pats his belly, points to Pam] Fewer carbs.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, if I could have seen what he just did, I think I would have gotten angry.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: A formal warning, seriously?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Well, as you know, Dwight has filed a lot of complaints against you over the years.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: And no one cared.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: But now it's being looked at as more of a productivity issue.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Productivity? My numbers are good.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I know, um, but Ryan thinks that, uh, they're not good enough.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Wallace likes Jim. So going after him - that's a risky move for me, but in business, you gotta take risks. Sometimes you gotta get out on the open highway, with the top down [pushes button about eight times to get the top down. Finally it comes down and it's all bunched up. As he's fixing it, the car rolls backwards a bit.]
